backend/main.mo: Main backend canister managing user profiles, flag validation, authorization, and social features like friend requests.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing implemented flag-image features, linked files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Human‐written summaries of various frontend source files used for build planning.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS defining warm OKLCH color tokens, theming variables, and Tailwind base styles.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app shell handling authentication, profile setup, dialogs, and layout with header and room/message views.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Login/logout button using Internet Identity with loading state and query cache clearing.
frontend/src/components/chat/InviteToRoo: Dialog for inviting friends to rooms, showing user profiles or fallbacks and performing add-to-room actions.
frontend/src/components/chat/MessageComp: Message input component allowing text and image messages with validation, preview, upload progress, and submission handling.
frontend/src/components/chat/MessageThre: Displays messages for a room with auto‑scroll, sender info, attachments, and error/empty states.
frontend/src/components/chat/RoomList.ts: Lists chat rooms and provides a form to create new rooms with loading, error, and selection handling.
frontend/src/components/friends/FriendsD: Dialog for searching users, viewing friends, and sending friend requests with profile fallback handling.
frontend/src/components/profile/FlagBadg: Shows a small flag image for a valid profile flag or nothing if invalid.
frontend/src/components/profile/ProfileE: Dialog for editing a user profile including name, bio, colors, profile picture upload, and flag selection.
frontend/src/components/profile/ProfileN: Inline display of a user's name with an optional flag badge.
frontend/src/components/profile/ProfileS: Modal form for creating a user profile with name and bio, saving via mutation and showing toast feedback.
frontend/src/components/profile/UserAvat: Renders a user's avatar using a profile picture if available, otherwise shows initials with configured colors.
frontend/src/components/settings/Setting: Dialog for adjusting theme and message polling interval with validation and immediate state updates.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the user's identity, refetching dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useChatRooms.ts: Provides hooks for listing rooms and creating rooms via actor methods with query invalidation.
frontend/src/hooks/useFriends.ts: Hooks for searching users, retrieving friends, and handling friend request mutations using the actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Context and hooks for managing Internet Identity authentication and exposing identity state and actions.
frontend/src/hooks/useRoomMembers.ts: Mutation hook to add a user to a room and invalidate the room list on success.
frontend/src/hooks/useRoomMessages.ts: Hooks to fetch room messages with polling and post new messages while invalidating relevant caches.
frontend/src/hooks/useUserPreferences.ts: Empty placeholder file for user preference hooks.
frontend/src/hooks/useUserProfile.ts: Hooks for fetching and saving user profiles with caching, error handling, and cache updates.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind layers and theme CSS variables for light and dark modes using OKLCH values, plus global base styles.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and the InternetIdentityProvider, then renders App.
frontend/src/utils/flags.ts: Provides a strict allowlist of safe flag options with lookup and validation helpers.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading, storing, and clearing URL and session parameters, supporting hash-based routing.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind theme extensions, colors tied to CSS variables, plugins, and container settings.
project_state.json: Tracks project metadata, requirements, constraints, branding notes, and existing features.
